p: Orexins/hypocretins consist of two orexins, orexin-A, and orexin-B, both cleaved from the same precursor, prepro-orexin ( 42, 43). In fish, both the prepro-orexin RNA and the peptides A and B have been shown to be abundant in the hypothalamus ( 44), as well as in the gastrointestinal tract ( 33). Two heptahelical G-protein coupled receptors are known to mediate orexin functions. Orexins have been reported to have a significant role in increasing feeding behavior and locomotor activity ( 33), and they were also implicated in the regulation of sleep, energy homeostasis and circadian cycle ( 45).
